message_2:
To solve for x, we will first isolate x by adding $(9 - 2i)$ to both sides of the equation and then dividing by $(3 + 4i)$. 

Step 1: Add $(9 - 2i)$ to both sides
$(3 + 4i)x - (9 - 2i) + (9 - 2i) = 5i + (9 - 2i)$
$(3 + 4i)x = 5i + 9 - 2i$

Step 2: Simplify the right side
$(3 + 4i)x = 9 + 3i$

Step 3: Divide by $(3 + 4i)$
$x = \frac{9 + 3i}{3 + 4i}$

Step 4: Multiply the numerator and denominator by the conjugate of the denominator, which is $(3 - 4i)$
$x = \frac{(9 + 3i)(3 - 4i)}{(3 + 4i)(3 - 4i)}$

Step 5: Expand the numerator and denominator
Numerator: $(9 + 3i)(3 - 4i) = 9(3) + 9(-4i) + 3i(3) + 3i(-4i) = 27 - 36i + 9i - 12i^2$
Denominator: $(3 + 4i)(3 - 4i) = 3(3) + 3(-4i) + 4i(3) + 4i(-4i) = 9 - 12i + 12i - 16i^2$

Step 6: Simplify the numerator and denominator
Numerator: $27 - 36i + 9i - 12(-1) = 27 - 36i + 9i + 12 = 39 - 27i$
Denominator: $9 - 12i + 12i - 16(-1) = 9 + 16 = 25$

Step 7: Divide the real and imaginary parts by the denominator
$x = \frac{39 - 27i}{25} = \frac{39}{25} - \frac{27}{25}i$

So, the solution for x is $x = \frac{39}{25} - \frac{27}{25}i$.
